algorithm_technique: Find median using QuickSelect, then check nearest palindromes to median.
Sort array to find median, then check nearest palindromes to median.
problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum cost to make all array elements equal to a palindromic number.
problem_summary_technical: Minimize sum of |nums[i] - palindrome| by finding the median and checking nearby palindromic candidates.
key_insights: The optimal target value is likely close to the median of the input array.
Generating candidate palindromes around the median is crucial.
QuickSelect provides an average O(n) median finding.
Sorting the array is a straightforward way to find the median.
The cost function is convex, so checking palindromes around the median is sufficient.
The `nearest_palindromic` helper function is key to generating candidates.
